original: Ehrlin, John, direktör, Värnamo, f. 10/9/87 i Ockelbo, Gävleb. I, av August E. o. Lovisa Hempel. G. 18 m. Elin Johannesson. Barn: Gunvor f. 19, Samuel 22. — Genomg. 5-klass. lärov. t. 01, prakt, skogs- o. lantbr. 02-06, bokför:- o. hand:kurs v. Kristinehamns prakt. ’sk. 07-08. Resa t. Tyskl. 37. Anst. h. Kopparfors A-B i Ockelbo 08-16, h. Siljans Kol A-B i Ornäs 16-20, v. Dalälvarnas fördeln :-kont. i Falun 20-23, omb :man h. Syd-sv. virkesfören. i Värnamo 23, verkst. dir. där sed. 43. V. ordf. i Värnamo stadsfullm. 38-46, ordf. i drätselkamm. 31-36, styrrled. o. ordf. i A-B Värnamo Nyheter, led. av styr, f. Värnamo Kraft A-B, rev. i Rydaholms Kraft o. Ind. A-B o. i Nissaåns flottn :fören., led. av past:råd o. av komm. f. statl., komm. o. skogl. utredn. Medl. av Odd Fellow. Hobbies: jakt o. jaktvård. RVO.
translated: Ehrlin, John, director, Värnamo, born September 10, 1887 in Ockelbo, Gävleborg County, the son of August E. and Lovisa Hempel. Married Elin Johannesson in 1918. They had two children, Gunvor born in 1919 and Samuel born in 1922. He completed five years of primary school education until 1901, and then worked in practical forestry and agriculture from 1902 to 1906. He took bookkeeping and business courses at Kristinehamn's practical school in 1907-1908, and traveled to Germany in 1937. He was employed by Kopparfors AB in Ockelbo from 1908 to 1916, by Siljans Kol AB in Ornäs from 1916 to 1920, by Dalälvarnas fördelningskontor in Falun from 1920 to 1923, and was a representative for the South Swedish Timber Association in Värnamo from 1923, and the Managing Director from 1943. He was Vice Chairman of the Värnamo City Council from 1938 to 1946; Chairman of the Finance Committee from 1931 to 1936; Board member and Chairman of AB Värnamo Nyheter; Board member of Värnamo Kraft AB; auditor of Rydaholms Kraft och Industries AB and Nissaåns Flottningsförening; member of the Church Council as well as the State, Municipal and Forestry Investigation Committees. He was a member of the Odd Fellow fraternal organization. His hobbies were hunting and wildlife conservation. He was awarded RVO.
